articles.content:
Early Normalization of Japan-DPRK Diplomatic Ties Urged in Japan 
    Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- The representatives of the executive committee of the "Osaka society calling for the early normalization of diplomatic ties between Japan and the DPRK on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of the Sept. 17 Pyongyang declaration" in a letter of request to the Japanese prime minister on Nov. 8 called for sincere implementation of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration and early normalization of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
 They criticized the Japanese government for applying economic sanctions to the DPRK over the "abduction issue" which had already been settled and called for the sincere implementation of the declaration, stressing the need to build the relations of confidence between the two countries.

articles.title: Unfair and Biased Investigation by S. Korean Prosecution Assailed
Third National Meeting of Mothers Held
articles.content:
Unfair and Biased Investigation by S. Korean Prosecution Assailed 
    Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Il, who was vice-chief of the Intelligence Service during Kim Dae Jung's tenure of office, recently committed a suicide under psychological pressure resulting from the unfair and biased investigation conducted by the south Korean prosecution authorities into the "illegal wiretapping case". 
 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland released information bulletin No. 909 as regards this case on Nov. 22. This was not a simple suicide but a tragedy that took place because of the attack mounted by the prosecution authorities on the June 15 reunification forces and leading players under the back-stage wirepulling of the anti-June 15 forces including the U.S. and the "Grand National Party" and at their instigation.  Ri's suicide was one more case of political murder committed by the fascist prosecution authorities on purpose, the bulletin notes, and goes on:
 The successive military fascist regimes harshly cracked down upon the democratic forces, openly clamoring for a "policy of intelligence," and the present GNP has committed the illegal wiretapping by setting up the so-called "Mirim team", a special wiretapping mechanism. They are chiefly accountable for the illegal wiretapping case.    
 However, the prosecution authorities are engrossed in the crackdown upon those who contributed to reunification and patriotism, taking no action against the GNP. Their behavior is a rash act beyond common sense and a treacherous act of betraying the backwardness of the south Korean politics.
 What happened over the above-said case made it clear that the prosecution institutions in south Korea manned by right-wing conservative elements are died-in-the wool pro-American and anti-June 15 forces and a stumbling block lying in the way of implementing the June 15 joint declaration and promoting progressive reforms there.    
 People of all social standings should decisively smash the moves of the right-wing conservative forces including the GNP keen to block social progress, divide and weaken the June 15 reunification forces and stem the trend of times toward national unity and reunification and turn out as one in the struggle for eradicating the fascist prosecution.

articles.title: Chairman of Chongryon Meets Widow of Former Indonesian President
Anti-DPRK Resolution on Human Rights Assailed
articles.content:
Chairman of Chongryon Meets Widow of Former Indonesian President 
    Tokyo, November 21 (KNS-KCNA) -- So Man Sul, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), met and had a talk with Ratna Sari Dewi  Sukarno, widow of former Indonesian President Sukarno, who paid a visit to the Korean Hall on Nov. 14.
 Present there was So Chung On, director of the international department of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon.
